sen.e: Tomotsune TOSHIMA (year of birth unknown - October 15, 1203) was a samurai (warrior) from the end of Heian period to the beginning of the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 治承4年（1180年）8月、平氏打倒の挙兵をした源頼朝は石橋山の戦いで大庭景親ら平氏方に敗れ、安房国へ逃れた。
sen.e: In August 1180, MINAMOTO no Yoritomo who had raised an army against the Taira clan was defeated by the Taira side including Kagechika OBA in the Battle of Ishibashiyama and fled to the Awa Province.

sen.j: 9月3日、頼朝は源氏恩顧の武士である豊島氏当主の清元とその子葛西清重に海路をもって安房国へ参じるよう命じ、また在京中だった朝経には、その妻女に綿衣を進呈するように命じている。
sen.e: On September 3, Yoritomo ordered Kiyomoto, who was the family head of the Toshima clan and a samurai (warrior) favored by the Minamoto clan, and Kiyoshige KASAI, the son of Kiyomoto, to go to the Awa Province on the sea route and also ordered Asatsune who were staying in Kyoto to present cotton clothes to his wife and daughter.

On September 30, Yoritomo ordered Kiyomoto who was the family head of the Toshima clan and favored by the Minamoto clan and his son, Kiyoshige KASAI, to go to Awa Province by sea and also ordered Asatsune who were in Kyoto to present cotton clothes to his wife and daughter.
sen.cmt: 旧暦を新暦に変更しました。また、文章を簡潔に書き換えました。

sen.j: 葛西清重は優れた武将で、源範頼に従軍して武功を立て、奥州合戦で活躍して奥州総奉行に任ぜられ、葛西氏は奥州の大族となっている。
sen.e: Kiyoshige KASAI was an excellent busho (Japanese military commander) with military exploits by joining an army of MINAMOTO no Noriyori, appointed to sobugyo (general magistrate) in the Oshu region by flourishing in the battle of Oshu, and consequently the Kasai family became a great clan.

sen.j: 建仁元年（1201年）7月、朝経は土佐国守護職に任じられた。
sen.e: In July 1201, Asatsune was appointed to Tosa no kuni no kami (governor) in the Tosa Province.
In August 1201, Asatsune was appointed as Tosa no kuni no kami (governor) in Tosa Province.

sen.e: In August 1201, Asatsune was appointed as Tosa no kuni no kami (governor) in Tosa Province.

sen.j: 北条時政の名の書状があり、同国内の深淵郷と香宗我部郷の地頭職に任じられた中原秋通に現地の住民が従わないため、朝経へ地頭職を強制執行するよう命じられている。
sen.e: The letter in the name of Tokimasa HOJO remains, and in which Asatsune was ordered to forcibly enforce Jitoshiki (stewardship rights) because local residents did not obey Akimichi Nakahara who was appointed to Jitoshiki in Fukabuchi-go and Kosogabe-go in the same province.

sen.j: 建仁3年（1203年）8月に土佐守護を三浦義村と交代。
sen.e: In August 1203, Asatsune was replaced by Yoshimura MIURA for Tosa no kuni no kami in the Tosa Province.

sen.j: 同年10月10日、比叡山衆徒が八王子山に城砦を構築して立て籠もり騒擾を起こす事態となった。
sen.e: In October 10 of the same year, Mt. Hiei's armed warrior priests constructed a fortress in Mt. Hachioji and caused a civil disorder by barricading themselves into it.
On November 22 of the same year, Mt. Hiei's armed warrior priests built a fortress in Mt. Hachioji and caused a civil disorder by barricading themselves inside.

sen.j: 朝経は同族（弟？）の葛西重元とともに官軍に加わり、討伐に向かい比叡山衆徒は蹴散らされたが、官軍300人が戦死し、佐々木重綱および、朝経、重元は討ち死にした。
sen.e: Asatsune joined the government army with Shigemoto Kasai of the same clan (younger brother?) for subjugation and those priests were subdued, but three hundreds of the government army were killed and also Shigetsuna SASAKI, Asatsune, and Shigemoto died in battle.

sen.j: 朝経は江戸時代に旗本豊島泰盈が作成した「金輪寺本豊島家系図」「泰盈本豊島家系図」では清元の長子とされ彼の系統が豊島氏の嫡流となるが、一族の旗本宮城氏の「豊島宮城系図」ではその名が現れない（こちらは葛西清重の系統が嫡流になっている）。
sen.e: According to 'Kinrin-ji Temple's Genealogies of TOSHIMA' and 'Yasumitsu's Genealogies of TOSHIMA' created by Yasumitsu TOSHIMA who was hatamoto (direct retainer) in the Edo period, Asatsune was the oldest son of Kiyomoto and his lineage became the main branch of the Toshima family, but his name was not described in 'Genealogies of Toshima Miyagi' by the Miyagi family who was the clan's hatamoto (the lineage of Kiyoshige KASAI is the main branch of the family in this genealogy).

sen.j: 系図で子とされる有経が元暦元年（1184年）に既に紀伊国守護人であることが確認されており（『根来要書』）、不自然な点がある。
sen.e: It is confirmed that Aritsune, who was described as Asatsune's son in the genealogy, was already the governor of the Kii province in 1184 ("Negoro Document Required"), and thereby it is unnatural.

sen.j: 豊島氏本宗家は室町時代に滅びており、系図はその200年以上後になって復元されたもので、人物の比定に混乱が見られ、近年の研究では朝経は系図では子になっている有経の子と推定され、親子関係が逆転している。
sen.e: The head family of the Toshima clan went to ruin in the Muromachi period and the genealogy was restored more than two hundred years later with confusion in identification of the people and in recent study, Asatsune is supposed to be the son of Aritsune who was described as the son in the genealogy and a parent and child relationship is in reverse.

The head family of the Toshima clan went to ruin in the Muromachi period and the genealogy was restored more than two hundred years later, with confusion in identification of the people, and in recent study, Asatsune was believed to be a son of Aritsune who was described as his son in the genealogy, and their parent-child relationship was reversed.
sen.cmt: 冠詞の変更、コンマの追加、supposedをbelievedにし、逆転の部分も書き換えました。
sen.e: The head family of the Toshima clan went to ruin in the Muromachi period and the genealogy was restored more than two hundred years later, with confusion in identification of the people, and in recent study, Asatsune was believed to be a son of Aritsune who was described as his son in the genealogy, and their parent-child relationship was reversed.

sen.j: 近年の研究を反映した系図では朝経の子（従来の系図では孫）の豊島時光の時に幕府から所領を没収され、朝経の系統は断絶した。
sen.e: In the genealogy reflected the recent study, their territory was confiscated by the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) at the time of Tokimitsu Toshima who was the son of Asatsune (grandson in the previous genealogy) and the lineage of Asatsune ended.
